frameDefinitions: An implicit experiencer has an Experience for the first time.
This frame describes an Agent's gathering of Individuals (people or entities) into a group, the  Aggregate, defined by relative proximity.
An Assailant physically attacks a Victim (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the Victim physical damage.
A Visitor arrives at the Host_location as a guest of the Host, for the purpose of achieving a Purpose.
A State_of_affairs has held and continues to hold up to the Reference_occasion.
frameExamples: In Italy the term was <t>first</t> used by the Venetians in 1546
The police <t>gathered</t> the suspects into a line-up.
As soon as he stepped out of the bar he was <t>set</t> upon by four men in ski-masks.
The dog went that <t>way</t>towards the ice cream factory.
I'm gonna <t>drop</t> <t>in</t> on Kieth for a while.
<t>To date</t>, the Department already has numerous requests for new systems to be developed.
listRoleDefinitions: An event happens for the first time within the <fen>Context</fen>.
This role identifies the aggregate that results from the gathering.  It may be expressed either as an adjunct result phrase or as a direct object of a target verb.
Agent is the person who gathers Individuals.
This role identifies the entities that come together to form an Aggregate.

This role identifies the time when the gathering event occurs, if specified.
The crowd assembled <fex name='Time'>at dawn</fex>.

This role identifies the place where the gathering event occurs.
He <t>assembled</t> the children <fex name='Place'>in the hall</fex>.
This role is the being or entity that is injured by the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s attack.
The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Assailant</fen> makes an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that traverses the trajectory.
The <fen>Source</fen> profiles the region where the <fen>Theme</fen> has travelled from (i.e. the region where the <fen>Theme</fen>'s movement began).

The <fen>Path</fen> is the region upon which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels. It is any region in between the <fen>Source</fen> (where the <fen>Theme</fen> departed from) and the <fen>Goal</fen> (where the theme will eventually arrive).
The <fen>Goal</fen> profiles the region at the end of the <fen>Theme</fen>'s <fen>Path</fen>. This is the region where the <fen>Theme</fen> movement stops.
The <fen>Visitor</fen> arrives at the Host_location to visit the <fen>Host</fen> for a <fen>Purpose</fen>.

The <fen>Host</fen> is the person highly associated with the goal location of the <fen>Visitor</fen>, and who allows the <fen>Visitor</fen> onto his/her territory, and possibly to make use of available resources. The <fen>Host</fen> and <fen>Visitor</fen> and in a host-guest relationship.
The <fen>Host_location</fen> is a place primarily associated with the <fen>Host</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when arriving occurs.
The larger area within which the visiting takes place.
A state which holds prior to and up through the <fen>Reference_occasion</fen>.
The time or event (normally speech time) with respect to which the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is located.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Made from flax, linen was</fex> first <fex>used by the ancient Egyptians</fex>.
The police gathered the suspects <fex>into a line-up</fex>.
<fex>The police</fex> gathered the suspects into a lineup.
The police gathered <fex>the suspects</fex> into a line-up.
The mysterious fighter attacked <fex>the guardsmen</fex> with a sabre.
<fex>The mysterious fighter</fex> attacked the guardsmen with a sabre.
<fex>As soon as he stepped out of the bar</fex> he was set upon by four men in ski-masks.
Then Jon-O's forces ambushed them <fex>on the left flank</fex> from a line of low hills.
<fex>How is your course going</fex> so far?
She was loving and concerned about others up to <fex>her dying breath</fex>.
